article.headline: Furman 72, NC Asheville 68
article.story: GREENVILLE, S.C. (AP) -- Quan Prowell scored 18 points, including 13 in the second half, as Furman held off a late rally to defeat North Carolina-Asheville 72-68 on Wednesday night. Ben Earle added 15 points and Robby Bostain 14 for the Paladins (3-3), who led by 16 early in the second half. Furman was up 62-47 with 7:30 remaining when the Bulldogs (0-4) used a 19-6 run to get within two at 68-66. Eric Webb's 10-footer with 8.5 seconds left and Prowell's free throw with 4.3 seconds remaining sealed the win. Bryan McCullough, who the Bulldogs' run with a rebound basket, scored 15 to lead North Carolina-Asheville, including nine during the late rally. Joseph Barber added 13 points and 10 rebounds. The Paladins hit their first six shots to open with a 17-4 lead after five minutes. They led by 11 at halftime and took their largest lead at 52-36 on Gerad Punch's lay-up with 13:26 to go.

statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.description: Free Throw makes and attempts.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover
